beckon.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make a signal to someone with your hand, to show that you want them to come towards you or to follow you
beckon.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I could see my husband beckoning me.
She beckoned to the waitress to bring more wine.
He beckoned us over and introduced us to his wife.
beckon.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if something such as a place or opportunity beckons, it appears so attractive that you want to have it
beckon.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: A career in the film industry beckoned.
beckon.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if something beckons for someone, it will probably happen to them
